thread.title: 11 Gorgeous Maang Tikkas For The All Kinds Of Brides
thread.title_full: 11 Gorgeous Maang Tikkas For The All Kinds Of Brides

title: 11 Gorgeous Maang Tikkas For The All Kinds Of Brides
text:
facebook 
Maang-tikka is the ultimate bridal accessory. You only need the wedding-fuelled power of a gorgeous one to brace for the big day. Think of it as a desi hair fascinator, only that it is far more wearable (fascinators, we still heart you), and it elevates your bridal beauty by a hundred levels‚Ä¶no make that thousand. If you are a bride who is, still, contemplating if you should wear one, well, the answer is HELL YES! There is a maang-tikka for each one of you bridechillas that will flawlessly frame your face, and maintain your bridal demeanour. Browse through our handpicked selection, to get a head start (LOL)- 1. Make a bridal statement with a forehead-framing maathapatti that won‚Äôt let anyone else steal your thunder. A photo posted by üëëshradha luthria (@dollyouup_bys) on Jan 20, 2017 at 1:31am PST 2. Pick a mini-me version that doesn‚Äôt lack in impact. A photo posted by SUNILEMMARPHOTOGRAPHY (@sunilemmar) on Nov 13, 2016 at 7:54am PST 3. Here‚Äôs a Punjabi-style tikka to channel your inner feisty bride. A photo posted by Kismet Jewell Nakai (@kismetjewellnakai) on Jul 3, 2016 at 12:40am PDT 4. Coordinate it with your outfit, to put your OCD to rest (we feel you, bride-to-be)! A photo posted by Stories by Joseph Radhik (@storiesbyjosephradhik) on May 16, 2016 at 4:11am PDT 5. Invest in a classic pair that is flanked by a solid string of pearls. A photo posted by Pooja Joseph Photography (@poojajosephphotography) on Feb 5, 2016 at 1:53am PST 6. Your day-wedding celebrations call for floral-themed accessories. A photo posted by Ashwin & Jhalak (@shadesphotographyindia) on Jan 12, 2017 at 11:57pm PST 7. Slam conventions, and sport this eclectic Outhouse beauty. A photo posted by Outhouse #outhousejewellery (@outhousejewellery) on Oct 13, 2016 at 3:22am PDT 8. Swap the regular ones with this chandbaali-inspired tikka that is bridal-verified on all accounts. Beautiful! ‚ù§‚ù§ #gorgeous #precious #pretty #wedding #weddingday #indianwedding #indianbride #lehenga #jewellery #mehendi #makeup #beautiful #amazing #weddingphotography #weddingphotographer #nowmarried #marriage #married #longtimelovers #highschoollove #makeuponfleek #coral #winelips A photo posted by Mahima Bhatia (@mahimabhatiaphotography) on Sep 22, 2016 at 10:20am PDT 9. Think the classics one are a tad OTT? Let this Rajasthani borla sit pretty on your forehead. A photo posted by Pooja Joseph Photography (@poojajosephphotography) on Dec 6, 2016 at 2:37am PST 
10. This three-stringed one should secure a definitive place in your bridal trousseau. 11. Channel your inner Mughal princess, and pair your tikka with a colour-coordinated passa.
